org.certificateservices.custom.c2x.ieee1609dot2.crypto

Interface Ieee1609Dot2CryptoManager

  • All Superinterfaces:
    CryptoManager
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    DefaultCryptoManager

    public interface Ieee1609Dot2CryptoManager
extends CryptoManager
    Interface defining methods used by c2x specific cryptographic methods.

    • Method Summary

    • Method Detail

      • signMessage

        Signature signMessage(byte[] message,
                      AlgorithmIndicator alg,
                      java.security.PrivateKey privateKey,
                      CertificateType certType,
                      Certificate signingCert)
               throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException,
                      java.security.SignatureException,
                      java.io.IOException
        Method used to sign the a message data according to the IEEE specification with EccPointType x_coordinate_only containing the R value.
        Parameters:
        message - the message data to sign.
        alg - the public key algorithm scheme to use.
        privateKey - the private key used to sign the message.
        certType - the type of certificate (implicit or explicit)
        signingCert - the signer or null if self signed.
        Returns:
        a IEEE 1609.2 Signature data structure containing the generated signature.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if supplied arguments was invalid.
        java.security.SignatureException - if internal problems occurred generating the signature.
        java.io.IOException - if communication problems occurred with underlying components.

      • signMessageDigest

        Signature signMessageDigest(byte[] digest,
                            AlgorithmIndicator alg,
                            java.security.PrivateKey privateKey)
                     throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException,
                            java.security.SignatureException,
                            java.io.IOException
        Method used to sign the a digest of message according to the IEEE specification with EccPointType x_coordinate_only containing the R value.
        Parameters:
        digest - the hash data to sign.
        alg - the public key algorithm scheme to use.
        privateKey - the private key used to sign the message.
        Returns:
        a IEEE 1609.2 Signature data structure containing the generated signature.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if supplied arguments was invalid.
        java.security.SignatureException - if internal problems occurred generating the signature.
        java.io.IOException - if communication problems occurred with underlying components.

                              java.security.PublicKey publicKey)

                              java.io.IOException

        signature - the signature to verify.
        publicKey - the signing public key.
        Returns:
        true if signature verifies.

        java.security.SignatureException - if internal problems occurred verifying the signature.

                        Signature signature,
                        Certificate signCert)
                 throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException,

                        java.io.IOException
        Method used to verify a IEEE Signature data structure given the message and the signers explicit certificate,
        Parameters:
        message - the message to verify.
        signature - the signature to verify.
        signCert - signing certificate, required, for self signed certificate use separate method.
        Returns:
        true if signature verifies.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if supplied arguments was invalid.
        java.security.SignatureException - if internal problems occurred verifying the signature.
        java.io.IOException - if communication problems occurred with underlying components.

                           throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException,

      • genNounce

        byte[] genNounce(AlgorithmIndicator alg)
          throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException,
                 java.security.GeneralSecurityException
        Method to generate a nounce for the given algorithm.
        Parameters:
        alg - algorithm indicator that must support symmetric scheme.
        Returns:
        a freshly generated nounce
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if algorithm didn't support symmetric algorithm.
        java.security.GeneralSecurityException - if internal problems occurred generating the random nounce.

      • constructSecretKey

        javax.crypto.SecretKey constructSecretKey(AlgorithmIndicator alg,
                                          byte[] keyData)
                                   throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException,
                                          java.security.GeneralSecurityException
        Method to reconstruct a symmetric from byte encoding.
        Parameters:
        alg - type of symmetric algorithm
        keyData - the raw key data.
        Returns:
        a reconstructed symmetric key.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if algorithm didn't support symmetric algorithm or key data was invalid.
        java.security.GeneralSecurityException - if internal problems occurred reconstructing the secret key.

      • symmetricEncryptIEEE1609_2_2017

                                       byte[] data,
                                       byte[] symmetricKey,
                                       byte[] nounce)
                                throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException,
                                       java.security.GeneralSecurityException
        Help method to perform a symmetric encrypt of data.
        Parameters:
        alg - the algorithm used to encrypt the data.
        data - the encrypted data.
        symmetricKey - the encrypt key.
        nounce - related nounce.
        Returns:
        the encrypt clear text data.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if arguments where invalid or algorithm not supported.
        java.security.GeneralSecurityException - if internal problems occurred encrypting

                                       byte[] nounce)

                                       java.security.GeneralSecurityException
        Help method to perform a symmetric decrypt of data.
        Parameters:

        data - the encrypted data.
        symmetricKey - the decryption key.
        nounce - related nounce.
        Returns:
        the decrypted clear text data.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if arguments where invalid or algorithm not supported.
        java.security.GeneralSecurityException - if internal problems occurred encrypting

      • ieeeEceisEncryptSymmetricKey2017

        EncryptedDataEncryptionKey ieeeEceisEncryptSymmetricKey2017(EncryptedDataEncryptionKey.EncryptedDataEncryptionKeyChoices keyType,
                                                            java.security.PublicKey encryptionKey,
                                                            javax.crypto.SecretKey symmetricKey,
                                                            byte[] p1)
                                                     throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException,
                                                            java.security.GeneralSecurityException
        Method to encrypt a symmetric key according to IEEE 1609.2 2017 specification.
        Parameters:
        keyType - the algorithm specification of the recipients public key.
        encryptionKey - the recipients public key to encrypt to.
        symmetricKey - the symmetric key to encrypt (Should be AES 128)
        p1 - the deviation used as recipient information (SHA256 Hash of certificate or "" if no related certificate is available).
        Returns:
        a EncryptedDataEncryptionKey with v,c,t set.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if supplied parameters where invalid.
        java.security.GeneralSecurityException - if problems occurred performing the encryption.

      • ieeeEceisDecryptSymmetricKey2017

        javax.crypto.SecretKey ieeeEceisDecryptSymmetricKey2017(EncryptedDataEncryptionKey encryptedDataEncryptionKey,
                                                        java.security.PrivateKey decryptionKey,
                                                        byte[] p1)
                                                 throws java.security.InvalidKeyException,
                                                        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException,
                                                        java.security.spec.InvalidKeySpecException
        Method to decrypt symmetric key using the 1609.2 2017 defined ECIES encryption scheme.
        Parameters:
        encryptedDataEncryptionKey - the type of encryption key.
        decryptionKey - the receiver's private key.
        p1 - the deviation used as recipient information (SHA256 Hash of certificate or "" if no related certificate is available).
        Returns:
        the decrypted AES symmetric key.
        Throws:
        java.security.InvalidKeyException - if supplied private key was invalid
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if invalid arguments where specified.
        java.security.spec.InvalidKeySpecException - if invalid key specification was given.

      • toBCECPublicKey

        org.bouncycastle.jcajce.provider.asymmetric.ec.BCECPublicKey toBCECPublicKey(AlgorithmIndicator alg,
                                                                             java.security.interfaces.ECPublicKey ecPublicKey)
                                                                      throws java.security.spec.InvalidKeySpecException
        Method to convert a EC public key to a BCECPublicKey
        Parameters:
        alg - specifying the related curve used.
        ecPublicKey - key to convert
        Returns:
        a BCECPublicKey
        Throws:
        java.security.spec.InvalidKeySpecException - if supplied key was invalid.

      • encodeEccPoint

        EccP256CurvePoint encodeEccPoint(AlgorithmIndicator alg,
                                 EccP256CurvePoint.EccP256CurvePointChoices type,
                                 java.security.PublicKey publicKey)
                          throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException,
                                 java.security.spec.InvalidKeySpecException
        Help method used to convert a public key to a Ieee EccP256CurvePoint data structure.
        Parameters:
        alg - the public key algorithm scheme to use.
        type - the type of ECCPoint to create.
        publicKey - the related public key to convert.
        Returns:
        a converted EccPoint data structure encoded according the the given ECC point type.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if public key was invalid or unsupported
        java.security.spec.InvalidKeySpecException - if the given public key contained invalid parameters related to the specified public key algorithm.

      • decodeEccPoint

        java.lang.Object decodeEccPoint(AlgorithmIndicator alg,
                                EccCurvePoint eccPoint)
                         throws java.security.spec.InvalidKeySpecException
        Help method to decode a EccP256CurvePoint or EccP384CurvePoint to a EccPublic key or ECFieldElement depending on the type of EccPoint.
        Parameters:
        alg - related public key algorithm.
        eccPoint - the ecc point to decode
        Returns:
        If EccPointType is not x_coordinate_only will only a BigInteger representing the ecdsa signature 'r' value, otherwise a PublicKey
        Throws:
        java.security.spec.InvalidKeySpecException - if problems occurred decoding the key.

      • encodeEccPoint

        EccP384CurvePoint encodeEccPoint(AlgorithmIndicator alg,
                                 EccP384CurvePoint.EccP384CurvePointChoices type,
                                 java.security.PublicKey publicKey)
                          throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException,
                                 java.security.spec.InvalidKeySpecException
        Help method used to convert a public key to a Ieee EccP384CurvePoint data structure.
        Parameters:
        alg - the public key algorithm scheme to use.
        type - the type of ECCPoint to create.
        publicKey - the related public key to convert.
        Returns:
        a converted EccPoint data structure encoded according the the given ECC point type.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if public key was invalid or unsupported
        java.security.spec.InvalidKeySpecException - if the given public key contained invalid parameters related to the specified public key algorithm.

      • genIEEECertificateDigest

        byte[] genIEEECertificateDigest(AlgorithmIndicator alg,
                                byte[] messageData,
                                Certificate signerCertificate)
                         throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException,
                                java.security.NoSuchAlgorithmException,
                                java.io.IOException
        Help method to generate a certificate digest according to 1609.2 section 5.3.1 Signature algorithm.
        Parameters:
        alg - the algorithm to use.
        messageData - the message data to digest
        signerCertificate - the certificate used for signing, null if selfsigned data.
        Throws:
        java.security.NoSuchAlgorithmException
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        java.io.IOException

      • getECParameterSpec

        org.bouncycastle.jce.spec.ECParameterSpec getECParameterSpec(AlgorithmIndicator alg)
                                                      throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Returns the related EC domain parameters for given algorithm.
        Parameters:
        alg - algorithm to fetch domain parameters for.
        Returns:
        related EC domain parameters for given algorithm.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException

      • reconstructImplicitPrivateKey

        java.security.PrivateKey reconstructImplicitPrivateKey(Certificate cert,
                                                       java.math.BigInteger r,
                                                       AlgorithmIndicator alg,
                                                       java.security.PrivateKey Ku,
                                                       java.security.PublicKey signerPublicKey,
                                                       Certificate signerCertificate)
                                                throws java.io.IOException,
                                                       java.lang.IllegalArgumentException,
                                                       java.security.SignatureException
        Method to construct the private key related to a generate certificate, given the related r value.
        Parameters:
        cert - the generated certificate.
        r - the private key r value
        alg - the related algorithm
        Ku - the private key generate for the certificate request.
        signerPublicKey - the CA public key.
        signerCertificate - the CA certificate
        Returns:
        a generated private key.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if communication problems occurred with underlying systems.
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if argument was illegal
        java.security.SignatureException - if internal problems occurred constructing the certificate private key.
